results.firPara: What a wonderful article by Simon Burnton (Apathy and the ecstasy how Englands summer turned gold, 30 July) full of anecdotes from the days when professional sport was accessible to us all, and not just about politics and money, as Simon Jenkins pointed out in his excellent piece on the Olympics (Denationalise the Olympics to stamp out cheating, 28 July).
results.secPara: Fifty years ago I went round to Michael Wheeldons house, a terrace in Riddings, Derbyshire, to watch the World Cup final with him and his family. My dad wouldnt have it on, and I wanted to watch it with people who could share the excitement.
results.webTitle: Fond memories of watching the 1966 World Cup final in black and white | Letters

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Hull, Chelsea shade, and plenty more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Hull, Chelsea shade, and plenty more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | You know it's bad when even Newcastle are making you look incompetent

results.firPara: Marcus Edwards has finally signed his first professional contract at Tottenham Hotspur. The 17-year-old attacking midfielder, who is rated as one of the brightest prospects from his age group in England, has agreed a two-year deal.
results.secPara: There had been months of wrangling over the terms, with Tottenham having made their offer when he turned 17 on 3 December of last year. The stand-off had led to fears that Edwards could be poached by a rival club but he has now signed and fans can expect to see him make his first-team debut this season.
results.webTitle: Marcus Edwards, 17, signs first professional contract at Tottenham

results.firPara: The Football Association of Wales has announced it has rejected an approach from Hull City for Chris Coleman.
results.secPara: Hull are searching for a manager after Steve Bruce resigned in frustration at a lack of signings.
results.webTitle: Hull City’s approach for Chris Coleman rejected by Welsh FA

results.firPara: Antonio Conte has pedigree and passion, but will that be enough to restore confidence at Stamford Bridge after last seasons disastrous title defence?
results.secPara: Antonio Conte has pedigree and passion, but will that be enough to restore confidence at Stamford Bridge after last seasons disastrous title defence?
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 preview No4: Chelsea | Paul Doyle

results.firPara: Even in this eyebrow-raising summer of exorbitant spending, the £37m spent by Manchester City on a 20-year-old with four international caps, one full season of senior football and zero trophies to his name does not rest entirely easily. Then again, Leroy Sané is no ordinary player.
results.secPara: When Pep Guardiola took over from Manuel Pellegrini and evaluated the squad he inherited, the Catalan may have noticed substantially bigger holes to plug – strengthening the defence perhaps, or adding weight to an at times flimsy centre midfield. City, on paper, look well stocked in the attacking midfield role Sané has thus far occupied but the manager was absolutely certain he would target a player who had been the subject of interest from the club for some time. The Germany international would fit his masterplan.
results.webTitle: Leroy Sané: a rough diamond who could be a Manchester City bargain at £37m | Alan Smith

results.firPara: If the Football Leagues new chairman, Ian Lenagan, had hoped to slip quietly into his role he has chosen the wrong time to start.
results.secPara: The revamped EFL Trophy format, with the introduction of academy sides from Premier League and Championship clubs, has provoked anger and derision. Meanwhile, attempts to get on the front foot in negotiations with the Premier League and the Football Association over fixture congestion – resulting in a proposal to expand the league to 80 teams across four divisions – sparked questions and concern among clubs and fans.
results.webTitle: Ian Lenagan: ‘If the Football League does not suggest solutions the FA or Premier League will’

results.firPara: The Chelsea defender Baba Rahman has joined Schalke on a season-long loan.
results.secPara: The Ghanaian left-back is returning to the Bundesliga having joined Chelsea from Augsburg just a year ago.
results.webTitle: Chelsea defender Baba Rahman joins Schalke on season-long loan

results.firPara: • Germany forward says Pep Guardiola convinced him to come
results.secPara: Manchester City have signed the Germany forward Leroy Sané from Schalke for £37m on a five-year contract.
results.webTitle: Manchester City sign Leroy Sané from Schalke for £37m
